title: Synthetic Recap
body:
WASHINGTON – In a performance for the ages, Karl Malone delivered a titanic effort, carrying the Utah Jazz to a hard-fought 100-93 victory over the Washington Bullets.

The Mailman delivered everything in his bag, scoring a colossal **41 points** and dominating the glass with **14 rebounds**. From the opening tip, Malone was an unstoppable force, attacking the rim with ferocious dunks and hitting his trademark mid-range jumpers with machine-like efficiency. The Bullets had no answer for his combination of power and finesse as he single-handedly powered the Jazz offense throughout the night.

While Malone’s historic night was the headline, his running mate provided the crucial support. John Stockton, the maestro of the offense, orchestrated the attack with a double-double of **19 points** and **14 assists**, consistently finding Malone in prime scoring position. Jeff Hornacek added **15 points** to round out a potent Jazz scoring attack.

The Bullets, despite a valiant effort, simply could not match the intensity of Malone’s historic outing. Juwan Howard led Washington with **24 points** and **10 rebounds**, while Calbert Cheaney chipped in **19 points**. However, their efforts were ultimately overshadowed by one of the league's premier players reaching a different plane entirely.

On this night, the story was not merely about a win or a loss, but about a legendary player authoring a chapter that would be remembered for years to come. Karl Malone didn't just beat the Bullets; he put on a masterclass.
